title: How Should We Treat the Moabites According to the Bible?
description:
Nehemiah and Noami took two different approaches to the Bible's teaching on Moabites.  Which one brought blessing?  Katherine Johnson joins me to discuss the dialogical way of interpreting scripture, and how it might help us understand how we should treat the Moabites.  Could this also have application to LGBTQ inclusion in the church?  

Katherine Johnson earned her B.A. in Christian Ministries from Spring Arbor University and has over 20 years of ministry experience in a wide variety of fields, both in churches and parachurch organizations. She has also earned an M.A. in Biblical and Theological Studies from Western Seminary and a Th.M. from Columbia Theological Seminary with a focus on Hebrew and Old Testament exegesis. 

Are you an LGBTQ Christian looking for help to see yourself in light of God's love?  Check out the Reformation Project's website:
https://reformationproject.org/

title: HELL: The Truth Finally Comes Out
description:
What does the Bible teach about the afterlife?  The Bible's clear teaching about the destiny of the wicked has been obscured by mainstream Christian teaching on this topic, which relies on tradition rather than the Bible.  Finally, the truth about what the Bible says is hitting the mainstream through Kirk Cameron.  I'll discuss the significance of this and clear up any remaining doubts about hell.  God is not sending anyone to a place of eternal conscious torment in hell.  

Not sure?  Check out some of my videos that show how hell is not the Bible's teaching about the afterlife:

title: Hey Pastor!  You Need to Face LGBTQ Questions
description:
This is a discussion for pastors and churches who need to carefully consider their stances on LGBTQ issues affecting their church members.  A church of any size is likely to have gay members, or members with gay relatives.  How will LGBTQ people be treated at your church?  Will they be loved?  Will they be treated equally?  Can they serve in leadership at the church?  Will you tell them it's a sin to be gay or be trans?  Would you marry a gay couple?  Many pastors would like to avoid thinking about these issues, and would prefer to stay quiet.  Have you been afraid to face these issues because you're conflicted?  If so, please give me the opportunity to help you with a Biblical framework for affirming your LGBTQ members and being a place where they feel comfortable and loved.

title: Christian Biochemist Says, "It's Beyond Evolution"
description:
Dr. Sy Garte discusses how Darwinian evolution has been a major point of contention, leading both scientists and Christians to mistakenly believe that science and the Bible are at odds. However, Dr. Garte asserts that evolution is irrelevant to the true harmony between faith and science. In fact, groundbreaking new discoveries in biology are offering stronger evidence than ever for a purposeful creator God.

Get Dr. Garte's book, Beyond Evolution at this link:
https://a.co/d/6ZKeBIr

In his book, "Beyond Evolution," Dr. Garte integrates the latest scientific research with a biblical perspective to explore several key ideas:

Evolution by natural selection isn't as central to biological science as commonly perceived, and the disagreements it has caused are detrimental to the Church.

Misinterpretations of both the Bible and science have led many to needlessly abandon their Christian faith.

Emerging evidence of purpose, agency, and decision-making at the cellular level strongly suggests a creator God.

The origins of life and human consciousness demonstrate that a purely materialistic and reductionist view of life is unsustainable and ignores recent scientific breakthroughs.

"Beyond Evolution" challenges both scientific and faith communities to pursue truth wherever it may lead, powerfully arguing that the evidence points towards a belief in a Creator.

Sy (Seymour) Garte, PhD in biochemistry, has been a tenured professor at New York University, Rutgers University, and the University of Pittsburgh, division director at the Center for Scientific Review of the National Institutes of Health, and interim vice president for research at the Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences. He is currently visiting professor at Rutgers University. He has published over two hundred peer-reviewed scientific papers and four books.
Dr. Sy Garteâ€™s website:

title: Is Your Trinity Father, Son, and Holy Bible?  Holy Spirit and LGBTQ Inclusion
description:
Let's talk about the one thing that seems to be hindering many Christians from becoming gay-affirming:  They are afraid to listen to the voice of the Holy Spirit who is guiding them to fully embrace gay people as they are.  I often hear Christians say, "But the Holy Spirit would never contradict what is written in Scripture."  Where did that idea come from?  The Holy Spirit has contradicted Scripture- we've got a record of it in Scripture!  Let's not be afraid to follow what the Bible tells us about the Holy Spirit:  He will guide us in all truth.  In this video, I'll discuss the guidance of the Holy Spirit and the Scripture that supports it.  Then we'll talk about how you can hear from the Holy Spirit about what the Lord's will is regarding gay marriage.

title: Jesus Saved Him From Porn Sets and Prostitution!
description:

Jesus's love changed Aaron's life, and he tells his story in "Bought with a Price."  I loved this book and wanted to take the opportunity to recommend it to you.  This is NOT a paid promotion. title: Barbaric Stuff in the Bible?  Here's Help!
description:
How should we understand some of the more difficult passages in the Bible, such as slavery, the killing of Canaanite children, and taking virgin women as plunder?  Christian apologists have a variety of ways of dealing with these passages, and I don't find any of them completely satisfactory.  In this video, I'm going to present a slightly different view that will hopefully help people who are wrestling with these difficult issues.

If you don't like my perspective, check out these other books on the topic:
Jesus Loves the Canaanites, by Randal Rauser @Randal_Rauser 
Is God a Moral Monster, by Paul Copan
The Word of a Humble God, by Karen Keen
Did God Really Command Genocide, by Paul Copan
Crucifixion of the Warrior God, by Greg Boyd

title: LGBTQ- Jesus Loves You As You Are:  Pastor Alicia Johnston
description:
Are you a Christian who is wrestling with issues regarding gender and sexuality?  Alicia Johnston is a pastor and pastoral counselor who fully affirms LGBTQ people, and is passionate about sharing the message that God loves you just as you are.  Join me to hear her story and get some of your questions answered.  

Alicia Johnston was a pastor in the Seventh Day Adventist Church and began to question the church's teaching on sexuality.  She spent a great deal of time studying and seeking answers about how the church should relate to LGBTQ people, and believes that God fully affirms LGBTQ people and blesses same-sex marriage. Alicia has a master of divinity from Andrews University in Berrien Springs, MI and a master of arts in Clinical Psychology from Argosy University.  She wrote a fantastic book called: The Bible and LGBTQ Adventists: a Theological Conversation about Same-Sex Marriage, Gender, and Identity

title: LGBTQ Christians- Inclusion and Affirmation with Sally Gary
description:
Pastor Sally Gary joins me to discuss LGBTQ inclusion and affirmation in the church, and her spiritual journey with God that led her to found the organization called CenterPeace- an LGBTQ+ Christian ministry.  CenterPeace is holding a conference Oct 24-26th, 2024, in Dallas, Texas.  Come join us there for a great time of fellowship!  Want to go to the conference and can't afford the cost?  Contact me at breadoflifechannel@gmail.com.  I don't want you to miss out, so I'll buy your conference ticket (limit 2).  Go to this link to learn more about the conference:
https://www.centerpeace.net/conference-2024

Learn more about CenterPeace at their website:
https://www.centerpeace.net

Karen Keen's video series:  Scripture and Sexual Ethics
https://reformationproject.org/courses/scripture-and-sexual-ethics/

About Sally Gary:
Sally is a pastor at heart, who not only oversees the mission of CenterPeace, as its founder, but also spends much of her time as a listening ear and guide for LGBTQ+ people, their families, and pastors and ministry leaders. Sally holds bachelor's and master's degrees in communication from Abilene Christian University, as well as a Doctor of Jurisprudence degree from Texas Tech University School of Law. She has coached high school and college speech and debate, worked as a civil trial attorney, and spent ten years teaching communication at ACU. Sally is a teacher and mentor at heart. Most of all, Sally is dedicated to helping LGBTQ people to know they are loved and that they belong. Everywhere. 

Originally from Wichita Falls, TX, Sally now lives in Dallas with her wife and their miniature dapple dachshund, Rudy. She is the author of two books: Loves God, Likes Girls (2013) and Affirming: A Memoir of Faith, Sexuality, and Staying in the Church (2021).

title: Christians, Slavery, & LGBTQ+:  Discussing the Biblical Connection
description:
How did Christians become anti-slavery?  The Bible does not specifically say that slavery is wrong.  So how is it that Christians today universally forbid slavery?  From the beginning of Christianity, there were church fathers who wrote that slavery was against God's will.  Abolitionists believed slavery was against God's will.  How did they know?  The same way they knew slavery was wrong, is the same way Christians today can know that God wants us to affirm the LGBTQ+ community and gay marriage.  Christians who oppose homosexuality on the basis of what the Bible says should also be pro-slavery. Let's talk about it!
@InspiringPhilosophy I'd love to hear your response.  Thanks!

title: A Miracle That Will Make You Angry- but Might Change Your Life
description:
I will be sharing a miracle that I personally experienced.  When I've shared this experience with people, even Christian friends and family (who believe in miracles) usually have a negative reaction or just don't believe it.  I expect that many people will be angry when I share this experience.  Since I know that it will upset people, why should I share it?  The reason I'm sharing it is because I want people to know the truth about the way God works in the world.  And if my story is true, it could profoundly change the way you live.  I'm still in the process of letting this experience change the way I live and behave.  

I expect that most people who watch this will not believe the miracle I share.  That's okay!  I understand that it is really hard to believe and it is totally natural to prefer alternative explanations.  Even my own husband didn't believe when I first told him- he had to experience it for himself.  So if my own husband who trusts my honesty didn't believe, I don't expect you to believe either!  But I'm sharing my true experience to the best of my ability, exactly as it happened.  Thanks!

*A correction to something I said later in the video:  I talked about Jenny getting healed, but actually, I think it might have been Gina who experienced the miracle I mentioned about the mouth surgery.

title: Why Is Part of Romans 8:1 Missing In My Bible?
description:
Romans 8:1, "Therefore, there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus."  Does the verse end there?  Or does it continue with, "Who do not walk according to the flesh but according to the Spirit"? Are you curious about why some Bibles don't have the second part of Romans 8:1?  In this video, I show you some of the oldest manuscripts we have of Romans 8:1, and talk about why some Bibles don't have the clause, "Who do not walk according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit."
We look at Codex Vaticanus from the 4th century, Codex Sinaiticus from the 4th century, Codex Alexandrinus from the 5th century, and Codex Claromontanus from the 6th century.
Thank you to the Center for the Study of New Testament Manuscripts for making many of these manuscripts available online!  Visit the website here:
https://www.csntm.org

Thanks for watching the Bread of Life Channel! Please subscribe: 
https://www.youtube.com/c/BreadofLifeChannel

title: When Atheism Fails, Jesus Christ's Love Will Find You
description:
Raised as a militant atheist, Dr. Sy Garte came to faith later in life.  In this interview, Dr. Garte discusses the failure of atheism, and how people are experiencing Christ's love and grace after they've realized that there is nothing substantive in the worldview they've been offered.  Dr. Garte is featured in a new book called Coming to Faith Through Dawkins.  You can order Coming to Faith Through Dawkins on Amazon at this link:
https://amzn.to/3tin1pn

Sy (Seymour) Garte, PhD in biochemistry, has been a tenured professor at New York University, Rutgers University, and the University of Pittsburgh, division director at the Center for Scientific Review of the National Institutes of Health, and interim vice president for research at the Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences. He is currently visiting professor at Rutgers University. He has published over two hundred peer-reviewed scientific papers and four books. His scientific work is what first caused him to consider God as an explanation for the reality we observe.  Dr. Garte is passionate about sharing the message that science and faith work together to speak to us about the greatness of God.  He has a new book coming out on this topic! title: Gender Non-binary Heroes in the Bible
description:
Would you be surprised to discover that there are gender non-binary heroes in the Bible?  Of course, the term gender non-binary is not used, but the word that indicated that someone did not fit neatly into the category of male or female was "eunuch."  The Bible has a lot to say about eunuchs, including a beautiful promise from God.  
Other videos discussing God's love for lgbtq people:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dUPJdGInxuI&t=2324s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5NFOVwvcVqc
https://youtu.be/tkkWPDz2TfI

*Several people have challenged my use of the term non-binary with my references to eunuchs in this video.  Many eunuchs identified as male, but the term eunuch seems to also apply to others that did not fit a category of male or female.  While not all non-binary people are eunuchs and not all eunuchs are non-binary, there is no word in ancient language that captures the same concept as non-binary today, and eunuch is the best term in the ancient cultures to describe people who differed from the gender binary in some way.  I realize that some people may still disagree with my characterization.  Here is the Nonbinary Wiki entry on this topic:
https://nonbinary.wiki/wiki/Eunuch

But many of themâ€¦we have great reason to hope, although they lived among the Heathens, yet were quite of another spirit; being taught of God, by his inward voice, all the essentials of true religion.â€ Pg 250 No Other Name

title: What ChatGPT Told Me About Hell
description:
Can AI make an argument against hell using the Bible?  When I asked ChatGPT to make a Biblical argument against hell, here's what it said:

"There are several biblical arguments that have been put forth against the concept of eternal punishment in hell. One argument is based on the idea of God's love and mercy. Many Christians believe that God is a loving and merciful God who would not condemn anyone to eternal punishment. This belief is supported by passages such as John 3:16, which states "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life." This passage suggests that God's ultimate desire is for people to have eternal life, rather than eternal punishment.

Another argument is based on the idea of repentance and forgiveness. Christians believe that God is a forgiving God who is willing to forgive anyone who repents of their sins. This belief is supported by passages such as Luke 15:7, which states "there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who do not need to repent." This passage suggests that God is eager to forgive those who repent, rather than punishing them eternally.

Additionally, the concept of hell as eternal punishment is not clearly stated in the bible, it's more of a concept that has been developed through the centuries based on different interpretations of scriptural passages. Some biblical scholars argue that the passages that are often used to support the concept of eternal punishment in hell can be interpreted differently, and that they may not necessarily imply eternal punishment.

It's important to point out that those are arguments based on religious belief and scriptural interpretation, and different individuals may have different interpretations of the bible."

More videos on the Biblical argument against hell:

title: Are Christians Unable to Stop Sinning?
description:
Sea Wolf writes:  Hey, Rebekah --- do you feel like Christians are in a state of being whereby they are simply unable to not sin? 
I question the value of the belief proposition when I hear Christians expound on the benefits of the system, while simultaneously seemingly unable to avoid sinning, to whatever degree. 
I don't consider these actions they are referring to as "sin" (whatever those actions may be). 
They consider themselves sinful --- not me. 
So, I question the sincerity of any Christian seemingly unable to stop doing whatever it is they feel so bad about. 
How can a Christian "spit at the feet" of Jesus knowing how much it pains their loving creator? 
Does this imply that a sinful Christian would also cheat on their perfectly loving partner? 
I'm not understanding what value all of these beliefs hold, if devoted Christians in direct relationship with Jesus and an all-mighty creator, KNOWING what they are commanded to do... would still ever choose to sin. 
Sounds like Christians are saying that they are simply programmed like robots to sin... by their designer.
Do Christians lack the Free Will to not sin?  Can't they control themselves. Can you not avoid choosing the "wrong" thing? 
Am I missing something? 
If so, please let me know the contradiction in my depiction and questions. 
Thanks --

This was a great comment and I feel it deserves a video response.  Thanks, Sea Wolf!

As Natalie sought answers to difficult theological questions, she rediscovered Jesusâ€™ good news message, written all over the pages of the gospels, proclaiming the Kingdom of God. title: Sal Exposes the Problems with Your Origin Story
description:
Sal is a frequent guest who often restrains himself during group discussions on my channel.  Tonight Sal speaks up to expose some major problems with the naturalistic origin story and show the superiority of the worldview that begins with "God created."  If you don't mind having your origin story challenged, I think you'll enjoy!  

Sal is a molecular biophysics researcher who works on scientific topics that advance both medical science and bio technology in addition to Creation Science and Intelligent Design.  He was previously a scientist and engineer in the aerospace and defense industry.  He has 5 science degrees including an MS in Applied Physics from Johns Hopkins University and an unaccredited MS in Biology from his professional work and classes at the FAES graduate school at the NIH.  

Sal's life story was featured in the April 27/28, 2005 cover story of the prestigious scientific journal Nature:
https://www.nature.com/articles/4341062a
 
He was featured also on national TV and radio, in books and newspaper articles in connection with his promotion of Intelligent Design.  However, one of the greatest accomplishments of his life was caring for his widowed and disabled mother for 18 years.
 
Sal's youtube channel is:
https://www.youtube.com/EvidenceAndReasons
 @Evidence and Reasons

www.EvidenceAndReasons.org

title: Killing Hell in Two Minutes
description:
Eternal conscious torment in hell is not the Biblical description of the afterlife.  In two minutes, Chris Date (hell expert) tells us why we should reject the view of eternal conscious torment in light of the Bible's clear teaching that the afterlife is life vs. death, not heaven vs. hell.  

Chris Date is Adjunct Professor of Bible and Theology at Trinity College of the Bible and Theological Seminary and co-editor of Rethinking Hell: Readings in Evangelical Conditionalism (Cascade, 2014) and A Consuming Passion (Pickwick, 2015). A full-time software engineer, Chris believes theology and apologetics are for every average joe in the pews, and not just for pastors, philosophers, PhDâ€™s and the erudite in ivory towers. Formerly a traditionalist, he became convinced of the biblical view of final punishment over the course of a process which began when he interviewed Edward Fudge, and he has since defended the view in several debates and on Justin Brierley's Unbelievable? radio program on Premier Christian Radio UK. Chris is also a steward of the Rethinking Hell project.

Visit Chris Dateâ€™s channel and website at these links:
https://www.youtube.com/user/rethinkinghell
https://rethinkinghell.com/

title: Were the Gospels Anonymous?
description:
How do we know that Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John wrote the gospels?  Matthew never says, "I am an eyewitness and I wrote this gospel."  Does that mean the gospels were written anonymously?  No.  There is a great deal of evidence that the gospel authors were always known, and that the titles, "The gospel according to Matthew (Mark, Luke, and John)" were always there.  The gospels were copied and distributed widely.  If they had been written anonymously and titled later, we should find some manuscripts that have titles attributed to different authors.  There is not a single manuscript that ever attributes one of the gospels to a different writer.  In an age of no telephone, and no quick way to communicate, how would the churches in so many different regions all collaborate to add the same titles?  We have very good reason to believe that the gospels were not anonymous and that the authors were known from the beginning.  

Check out a great paper on this topic:
https://academic.oup.com/jts/article-abstract/69/2/447/5101372

Chris Date is Adjunct Professor of Bible and Theology at Trinity College of the Bible and Theological Seminary and co-editor of Rethinking Hell: Readings in Evangelical Conditionalism (Cascade, 2014) and A Consuming Passion (Pickwick, 2015). A full-time software engineer, Chris believes theology and apologetics are for every average joe in the pews, and not just for pastors, philosophers, PhDâ€™s and the erudite in ivory towers. Formerly a traditionalist, he became convinced of the biblical view of final punishment over the course of a process which began when he interviewed Edward Fudge, and he has since defended the view in several debates and on Justin Brierley's Unbelievable? radio program on Premier Christian Radio UK. title: Are Christian Women to Be Silent and Subordinate?  Talk with New Testament Scholar, Nick Quient
description:
Does the New Testament discriminate against women?  Are Christian women supposed to take a subordinate role in the church and in the home?  Join me for a discussion with New Testament scholar Nick Quient who has focused his study on women in ministry.  He has spent a considerable amount of time studying some New Testament verses that have led some Christian denominations to prohibit women from leading and assign them a subordinate role in marriage.  We will be discussing 1 Timothy 2:11-15, 1 Corinthians 11 & 14 and more!  If you are a Christian woman who has been told that you can't lead or teach men, this video is for you.  

Nick Quient is a pastor, theologian, and author.  He holds an M.A. in Biblical Studies from Fuller Theological Seminary and is currently working on a Ph.d.

Here is a link to Nick's YouTube channel, New Testament Theologist: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQsupQJMc69c_TmiUlP05PA

@New Testament Theologist

Nick and his wife Allison have a podcast called The Split Frame of Reference: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-split-frame-of-reference-podcast/id1176375687

Here is the link to Nick's book, The Perfection of Our Faithful Wills: Paul's Apocalyptic Vision of Entire Sanctification:

title: A Faint Heart Never Won a Fair Maiden
description:
To honor his parents and to share the gospel of Jesus Christ, Salvador Cordova retells the love story of his parents Angelo and Esther Cordova.  They met as children in the Philippines, but World War 2 separated them while Angelo fought to liberate their homeland from the Imperial Japanese invaders.  After the war, Angelo rescued Esther from an armed attacker.  The attacker was armed with a gun, and Angelo was armed only with his willingness to die to protect Esther.  In the face of Angelo's bravery, the attacker relented.  Angelo's courage won the heart of Esther and led to a 56-year marriage that was part of Esther's larger love story that lasted 85 years which included the 2-decades that her loving children cared for her when Angelo grew ill and went home to be with the Lord.

Sal is working on essays that share the gospel through commentary on historical and archetypal love stories.  He describes real men of courage like Major Jeff Strueker and Angelo Cordova and the men who gave their lives for their wives on the Titanic.   Christ defines how a man should live his life, in that a man should bear his cross for what is right and offer his life for the woman he loves as Christ did for the church.

Sal will talk briefly about 2 Cor 4:17 and the historical romance of CS Lewis, "the honeymoon that could have lasted forever".

He'll read sections from the diary of his father and reviews historical documents and photos during the Imperial Japanese occupation and the Battle of Luzon, especially the landing of the 11th Airborne on Tagaytay Ridge.

Sal will argue that not only does the physical evidence support the Christian faith and the Hidden God, but also offers satisfying answers to the agonies and ecstasies of romantic love, the problem of evil, and the meaning of life, the origin and specialization of male and female.  The answers of Christianity surpass the viewpoints of atheism, naturalistic evolutionism, and modern feminism.

BIO:  Sal has been rated as the #1 YouTube Creationist, he has 5 science degrees including an MS in Applied Physics from Johns Hopkins University and an unaccredited MS in Biology.  He's published in secular scientific journals, and his life story is told in the April 27/28, 2005 cover story of the prestigious scientific journal Nature.

Visit Sal's channel, Evidence and Reasons:
https://www.youtube.com/EvidenceAndReasons
@EvidenceandReasons 
Sal's website is:
www.EvidenceAndReasons.org

title: How This Christian Lost His Faith
description:
In this interview I'll talk with Nidemos about what caused him to lose his faith:

Here is how Nidemos describes himself:
A currently deconverting Christian. For the past 12 years, I was an active member of a high-commitment church community. I was engaged in personal discipleship relationships, teaching small bible studies, hundreds of hours worth of elective spiritual classes and several meetings per-week. I personally worked to convert people to Jesus. I was very comfortable talking about Jesus in public with close friends and strangers. Now, I am going through a very difficult transition as I explore the world outside the church and engage in the broader conversations of belief. I am open to new evidence. I am always willing to share perspective. I'm willing to be wrong! I'm open to conversations with everyone from all perspectives and want to contribute to open dialogue.

title: Cures for Doubting Thomas:  Sal's Help for Those Struggling to Keep the Faith
description:
Salvador Cordova shares how the Lord restored him to faith so many times after nearly walking away from Christianity during his life as a scientist and engineer.  He shares some of the principles of being restored to faith with scriptures such as Romans 12:3  "the measure of faith God has given you",  John 10:38 "even though you do not believe me, believe the works,", James 5:16 "confess your faults to one another that you may be healed",  John 20:29 "Blessed are those who believe yet have not seen", and more...
 
Sal will talk about how the Invisible God inspires faith through the study of science, archaeology, and the miracles of changed lives and answered prayers.

Sal was recently voted the #1 Youtube creationist.  He is presently a molecular biophysics researcher who works on scientific topics that advance both medical science and bio technology in addition to Creation Science and Intelligent Design.  He was previously a scientist and engineer in the aerospace and defense industry.  He has 5 science degrees including an MS in Applied Physics from Johns Hopkins University and an unaccredited MS in Biology from his professional work and classes at the FAES graduate school at the NIH.  

Sal's life story was featured in the April 27/28, 2005 cover story of the prestigious scientific journal Nature:
https://www.nature.com/articles/4341062a
 
He was featured also on national TV and radio, in books and newspaper articles in connection with his promotion of Intelligent Design.  However, one of the greatest accomplishments of his life was caring for his widowed and disabled mother for 18 years.

title: Is the Husband the Boss in Marriage?  Understand Ephesians 5
description:
Mike Winger and some other popular Christian teachers push the idea that women are subordinate to men in marriage.  They are wrong.

Ephesians chapter 5:21-33 is a beautiful passage of scripture that begins with, "Submit to one another out of reverence for Christ."  This passage gives us a wonderful description of what it means to honor one another above ourselves, and the imagery of Christ's death being our source of life.  Unfortunately, the metaphorical use of the word head in English (to mean boss or authority) has confused and caused misinterpretations of this passage in Ephesians.  Instead of being a passage about the mutual honor and submission Christians carry out for one another, these verses have been widely used as a call for Christian women to understand marriage as a hierarchy, where the husband is in charge.  There is a better interpretation for this passage.

Articles that discuss this topic:
https://www.pbpayne.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/what-about-headship-ch7.pdf
https://www.cbeinternational.org/resource/article/mutuality-blog-magazine/what-say-when-someone-says-wives-should-submit-husbands
https://www.cbeinternational.org/resource/article/mutuality-blog-magazine/misinterpreting-head-can-perpetuate-abuse
https://www.cbeinternational.org/resource/article/priscilla-papers-academic-journal/significance-kephale-head-study-abuse-one-greek
https://www.cbeinternational.org/resource/article/mutuality-blog-magazine/unavoidable-link-between-patriarchal-theology-and
https://www.cbeinternational.org/resource/article/priscilla-papers-academic-journal/biblical-model-marriage

For more answers to difficult Bible questions, visit my website:
breadoflifechannel.net

This story is found in Matthew 15 and in Mark 7.

Matthew 15:21-28
Leaving that place, Jesus withdrew to the region of Tyre and Sidon.  A Canaanite woman from that vicinity came to him, crying out, â€œLord, Son of David, have mercy on me! My daughter is demon-possessed and suffering terribly.â€
 Jesus did not answer a word. So his disciples came to him and urged him, â€œSend her away, for she keeps crying out after us.â€
 He answered, â€œI was sent only to the lost sheep of Israel.â€
The woman came and knelt before him. â€œLord, help me!â€ she said.
He replied, â€œIt is not right to take the childrenâ€™s bread and toss it to the dogs.â€ â€œYes it is, Lord,â€ she said. â€œEven the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masterâ€™s table.â€

 Then Jesus said to her, â€œWoman, you have great faith! Your request is granted.â€ And her daughter was healed at that moment.

title: What Race Was Paul Running?  1 Corinthians 9 in Context
description:

"Do you not know that in a race all the runners run, but only one gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize. Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last, but we do it to get a crown that will last forever. Therefore I do not run like someone running aimlessly; I do not fight like a boxer beating the air. No, I strike a blow to my body and make it my slave so that after I have preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified for the prize." 1 Corinthians 9:24-27

title: Why So Many Christian Denominations?  Who Worships the Right God?
description:
If Christians know God, why do they disagree about so many things?  Who is right?  How can we know who is worshiping the correct version of God? I hope to clear up the confusion and answer these questions in a way that satisfies.  This talk was inspired by Gray, Pinecreek, and all the others who have asked this question on my channel.

title: "Jacob I Have Loved, Esau I Have Hated"?  Explanation of Malachi 1 and Romans 9
description:
Does God hate people?  What does it mean when God says, "Jacob I have loved, Esau I have hated"?  In this video we will discuss the two passages of Scripture that contain this verse and what it means in context.  In both passages, the meaning is figurative, not literal.  God brought judgment against the descendants of Esau when they unjustly fought against Israel.  Malachi chapter 1 is describing God's judgment.  Romans 9 describes how God chose the descendants of Jacob before the boys had even been born.

title: Justified by Faith or Works?
description:
Romans 3:28 says, "For we maintain that a person is justified by faith apart from the works of the law."  James 2:24 seems to say the opposite:  "You see that a person is justified by works and not by faith alone."  Is this a contradiction?  When we read these verses in context, we see that this is not a contradiction.  James explains that Abraham "believed God and it was credited to him as righteousness."  Romans says that we are justified by faith.  James explains that faith produces action.  For some people, this passage in James brings fearful thoughts:  "What if my faith isn't real?  What if my faith doesn't produce enough?"  I hope that this video will give peace and confidence to sincere believers in Jesus.  I have also produced a free resource called, "Saved and Forgiven Forever."  You can get that and other free resources at my website:

title: Was It Immoral for Jesus to Be Sacrificed for the Guilty?  Response to Atheists
description:
Was Jesus's death on the cross immoral because an innocent man was punished for the crimes of the guilty?  Was this cosmic child abuse?  I frequently hear this criticism of Christianity, so I thought it was important to address it.  Jesus is not a random innocent person dying for the crimes of the guilty.  He is God.  Who can tell God not to die for the guilty?  This is not immoral.  It isn't cosmic child abuse.  This is our God and his love for us.  

The video clip expressing this criticism is taken from Alex O'Conner (Cosmic Skeptic).  You can find his full video at:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VvcOfUrHS5U

title: Why Harsh Penalties for Breaking Laws of Moses?
description:
When people read the Bible for the first time, they are often surprised by the harsh penalties for breaking the laws of Moses.  The Old Testament laws have been the subject of much ridicule of the Bible by the atheist community.  And Christians wonder, why was God so strict?  Why the death penalty for working on the Sabbath?  In this video I discuss why I believe God imposed strict penalties at that time, and how God's nature isn't to impose strict rules.  The laws of Moses are an exception to the way God normally deals with humanity.  

For a free resource that will explain the difference between God's covenant with Israel and God's covenant with you, visit my website:

title: Couldn't God Create a World with No Possibility of Suffering?
description:
Some people wonder why God couldn't create a world with no possibility of suffering.  God could still give humans free will, but just make it so that whatever they choose does not result in pain and suffering.  In this video I discuss the reason I believe God did not create such a world: He gave humans real responsibility.  God did not just give humans free will, he actually trusted us with governing the world.  Real responsibility comes with a risk.

title: Shocking Truth about Slavery in the Bible
description:
Slavery is a prominent theme in the Bible.  The word slave appears more than two hundred times in the Bible, and the Bible describes physical slavery and spiritual slavery.  Some people wonder why God did not abolish slavery when he gave the laws through Moses.  Indeed, some of the most difficult passages of scripture are the ones that discuss slaves in the laws of Moses.  In this video, I will discuss those difficult passages, as well as the bigger redemption story of Jesus Christ coming to set us free from slavery to sin, death, and fear.  And the most startling imagery of all:  That our God became a slave, and calls us to do the same.  Jesus said, "Whoever wants to be great among you must be your servant, and whoever wants to be first must be slave of all."  

If my discussion on slavery in the laws of Moses is unsatisfying, here are some videos by someone with much more expertise in the Biblical language and culture:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nBz1D8qJNyI
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kc9NGeT8z04

title: O the Deep, Deep Love of Jesus
description:
A modern rendition of the favorite hymn, O the Deep, Deep Love of Jesus
Arranged and produced by Sam Hashemi
Vocals by Rebekah Davis and Sam Hashemi

Original Music:
Author: S. Trevor Francis
Tune by:  Thomas J. Williams

Lyrics:
O the deep, deep love of Jesus!
Vast, unmeasured, boundless, free,
rolling as a mighty ocean
in its fullness over me.
Underneath me, all around me,
is the current of thy love;
leading onward, leading homeward,
to thy glorious rest above.

O the deep, deep love of Jesus!
Spread his praise from shore to shore;
how he loveth, ever loveth,
changeth never, nevermore;
how he watches o'er his loved ones,
died to call them all his own;
how for them he intercedeth,
watcheth o'er them from the throne.

O the deep, deep love of Jesus!
Love of ev'ry love the best:
'tis an ocean vast of blessing,
'tis a haven sweet of rest.
O the deep, deep love of Jesus!
'Tis a heav'n of heav'ns to me;
and it lifts me up to glory,
for it lifts me up to thee.

title: Does God Forgive Deliberate Sins?
description:
Many people are confused and afraid when they read Hebrews 10:26.  Does this mean that God doesn't forgive deliberate sins?  No!  If God didn't forgive deliberate sins, he wouldn't be able to forgive any human who has ever lived. When we put this verse back in its proper context we understand that the sin being talked about is the sin of turning away from Jesus Christ and going back to the sacrificial system in God's covenant with Israel.

To understand the difference between God's covenant with Israel and God's covenant with you, visit my website:
breadoflifechannel.net

description:

title: Is the Bible without Errors?
description:
Christians sometimes use the word inerrant to describe the Bible.  Is the Bible inerrant?  The Bible you hold in your hand is probably not error free, but it is a reliable witness of who God is and his plan for humanity.  This video discusses the reliability of the Bible, while recognizing the various factors that may have caused your Bible to have errors:  Differences between manuscripts, copy errors, translation errors, translation bias due to culture, and printing errors.  While all of these errors have happened, the Bible is still the most attested writing of antiquity that exists.

title: Should Christian Women Wear Head Coverings?  Explanation of 1 Cor 11
description:
Don't want to watch Mike Winger's 7 hour video on head covering?  Christian women, watch this instead!  This video discusses how to understand 1 Corinthians 11 when it discusses women wearing head coverings when they pray and prophesy.  Some instructions in the Bible are meant to be universally applied, and others are applied within a cultural context.  For most modern Christian women, head covering is not a norm within society.  Like we do with many other Biblical instructions, we apply the Biblical principle within our society's cultural norms.  

I disagree with Mke Winger's conclusion about women in ministry, but he does a good job discussing head coverings:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=keXayp7JXf4

Here is a great video about the cultural context of Corinth:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UoegVdstfn4&list=PLrxX6_-tnaWVVDB4BiOt9_aZMOJWk0PHn&index=38

Passage discussed:  
1 Corinthians 11: 5-6
"But every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her headâ€”it is the same as having her head shaved. For if a woman does not cover her head, she might as well have her hair cut off; but if it is a disgrace for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved, then she should cover her head."
Here are some interesting articles related to this topic:
https://www.cbeinternational.org/resource/article/mutuality-blog-magazine/translation-trouble-1-corinthians-11
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/322078662_The_Application_of_Women_Wearing_Head_Covering_and_Their_Role_in_Ministry_-_Based_on_1_Corinthians_113-6_and_1434_35

O come, O come, Emmanuel
And ransom captive Israel
That mourns in lonely exile here
Until the Son of God appear
Rejoice! Rejoice! Emmanuel
Shall come to thee, O Israel


O come, thou Day-Spring, come and cheer
Our spirits by thine advent here
Disperse the gloomy clouds of night
And Death's dark shadows put to flight
Rejoice! Rejoice! Emmanuel
Shall come to thee O Israel

O come, desire of nations, bind
All peoples in one heart and mind
Bid envy, strife and quarrels cease
Fill the whole world with Heavenâ€™s peace
Rejoice! Rejoice! Emmanuel
Shall come to thee, O Israel

title: Do Muslims and Christians Worship the Same God?
description:
How much correct information does someone need to have in order to be worshiping the true God?  The Bible says that creation speaks about the glory of God and that we can clearly see who God is from what he has made.   There are many people who recognize the Creator and worship him, though they may have some incorrect information about Jesus.  In this video I discuss the Biblical basis for understanding how Muslims and Christians can be worshiping the same God, even though we might have some incorrect information about him.  God doesn't wait until we have all the right information before he communicates with us.  God cares about the heart, and he responds to those who seek him in faith.

title: Is God in Control?
description: A popular misconception is that God is in control.  If God was in control, we wouldn't need his protection or help or guidance.  The Bible is filled with cries to God for help, and God's promises to help us in time of need.   We do not get the idea that God is in control, but that there is a battle between good and evil.  We know that God will have victory in the end, but right now there are many events happening that God does not control.

title: Happiness Is a Cruel God to Serve
description: People sometimes elevate happiness to the ultimate goal of life.  When happiness is our first priority, it has become a god.  And happiness is a cruel god to serve, because it always remains just out of reach, or once obtained, is always in danger of being lost.  Rather than making happiness your god, serve the Creator, and happiness is often a natural result.  Happiness was never meant to be sought after.  It is a byproduct of a life centered on God.

title: Is Jesus the Only Son of God?
description: When a seed is buried in the ground, the seed dies so that many new seeds can appear.  Jesus died on the cross, giving his life for our sins.  Jesus gave his life, and like a seed when it is buried, Jesus's death, burial, and resurrection means that new life can appear.  The purpose of Jesus's suffering was that many new sons and daughters of God could be born.  The Bible says that all who believe in Jesus become children of God.  Now, God does not have only one son, but a multitude of sons and daughters.  You can be one of them through faith in Christ Jesus.

title: What Is Sin?
description: What exactly makes something sinful?  Did God arbitrarily choose some things to be bad and some things to be good?  We learn what sin is from understanding the nature of God.  God is love.  And he created us in his image, to be beings full of love.  Jesus said all the law and prophets hang on these two commands:  love God, and love your neighbor.  The essence of sin is action that is not founded in love.

And what about when a Christian leader disappoints you?  We have all heard of scandals involving Christian leaders, and some of us have been personally affected by bad actions of leaders we trusted.  This video talks about how we should respond to the confusion and disappointment and how to see Christian leaders in the light of Christ.

title: Why Did God Let Satan Torment Job?
description:
The book of Job is a brilliant yet often misunderstood writing in the Bible.  After reading, people are often left with the question:  Why did God let Satan torment Job?  Wasn't that cruel for God to allow Satan to do that?  Some readers will walk away judging God, but some readers will learn the lesson that Job and his friends learned:  human judgment is full of error because we never have all the information.  At the end of the story, Job and his friends decided to leave judgment to the one Being who has all the information.  Will you do the same?

title: How Many Times Is Hell in the Bible?  54? 13? Or Zero?
description:
How many times is hell mentioned in the Bible?  That depends on which translation you read.  This video is a discussion of the words that have been historically translated as hell in English, and how those words should not have been translated that way.  The concept of hell as a place of eternal conscious torment is not faithful to the Biblical text, nor is it faithful to the essence of Christianity.  This video will give you good reasons to ditch the idea of eternal conscious torment in hell, and embrace a more Biblical view of the afterlife.

title: What Do Scientists Admit About the Origin and Evolution of Life?
description:
Has the theory of evolution been scientifically proven?  What about the origin of life?  Despite the widespread belief in evolution within the scientific community, scientists who research the topic make honest admissions of how much we really donâ€™t know.  We do not know how life originated and we do not know how it developed.  The theory of evolution has not been scientifically proven.  In fact, there are some major and probably insurmountable problems with the idea that life could originate spontaneously and develop through evolutionary processes.  This video discusses what the scientists who are experts in these fields have to say about the origin and development of life.  
Books quoted from in this video:
From Matter to Life:  Information and Causality, edited by Sara Imari Walker, Paul C.W. Davies, and George F.R. Ellis, Cambridge University Press, 2017.
Mutation-Driven Evolution, by Masatoshi Nei, Oxford University Press, 2013.
Biochemical Evolution:  The Pursuit of Perfection, by Athel Cornish-Bowden, second edition, Garland Science, 2016.

title: Why Doesn't God Give More Specific Guidance?
description: People sometimes wonder, "Why God doesn't always give us specific guidance about what to do?" When God told Noah to build the ark, he told him what size to make it, which materials to use, and what to bring on board.  But many of us don't receive that type of specific guidance from God.  Why?  God has given us basic guidance for life, telling us what is right and wrong.  With the guidance and boundaries he has given us, there are a variety of ways that we can bring goodness and beauty into the world.  I think half the fun for God is seeing our creativity.  What will we do with what he has given us?  What unique decisions and expressions will you make that delight the heart of God?

description: Is fearing God a good thing?  Does God want us to fear him? Is there anyone who shouldn't fear God?  Is there anyone who should?  This video explores the role of fear in our relationship and experience with the Creator of the Universe.

title: How to Read the Bible
description: People sometimes have the idea that the Bible is a difficult book to read, but most of it really isn't difficult.  The Bible is an amazing book that reveals who God is and tells us the highlights of God's history with humanity.  Much of the Bible is exciting, some of it is a bit dull, and some parts are horrifying, but all of it is enlightening, and it has a great ending that includes you. This video is a short introduction to what is in the Bible, along with an invitation to read the Bible with me on live stream.

title: Coronavirus:  Is It from God?
description: Coronavirus is becoming a significant concern that is causing fear in many people.  When something like this happens, people wonder why and sometimes falsely attribute natural disasters and epidemics to God.  Is God responsible for Coronavirus?  We can look at the life of Jesus to get the answer to this question.  Jesus had one response to sickness:  he cured it.  We should consider God the healer of sickness, not the bringer of sickness.  This video explores God's work in the world and how it relates to Coronavirus and to your life.

title: If You Let Yourselves Be Circumcised, Christ Will Be of No Value to You?
description:
Galatians 5:2 says that if you let yourselves be circumcised, Christ will be of no value to you at all.  What does this mean?  What does circumcision have to do with the value of Christ for us?  The Bible has a lot to say about men chopping off their foreskins.  In this video, I will explain why Paul is getting so riled up about circumcision in his letter to the Galatians, and how that applies to Christian men today.

title: Everyone Needs the 12-Step Program
description: The 12-Step program has been a useful tool for people in recovery from alcohol and drug addiction.  But the 12-Step program is more than just a tool for recovery, it is a way of approaching life.  All humans have problems, and these steps are essential principles for relating to God, other people, and to ourselves.

title: Help for the Lonely
description:
Many people feel completely alone in this world.  Even some people who are rich and famous and seem to be surrounded by people who adore them still feel lonely.  In this video,  I hope to help those who have felt in despair because of loneliness by sharing some words of truth from the Lord Jesus.  The truth is that you are never alone.

title: Which Came First, the Proto-Chicken or the Proto-Chicken Egg?
description: Which came first, the chicken or the egg?  This question presents a difficult problem for the theory of evolution.   The evolutionary answer to this question is that the egg came first.  The proto-chicken laid the first chicken egg.  However, this does not solve the insurmountable problem that Evolution faces when it comes to reproduction.  Evolution requires millions of years for developments in organisms, but no organism has millions of years to develop a functioning reproductive system.  There is no scientific answer to the classic problem of the chicken and the egg.  There are only stories.  I reject evolutionary tall tales.  I believe the story that starts with, "In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth."  God created the chicken, the egg, and the rooster.

title: Pizza for Breakfast Evolution Style
description: How long would it take to get a pizza to develop naturally if all the right ingredients were present?   Those who promote the theory of evolution want us to believe that a bunch of swirling chemicals could naturally develop into complex living beings.  Scientific observation and common sense give us a different picture of reality.  We need more than the right ingredients, we need an intelligent being to put them into an ordered state.  A pizza needs a pizza maker.

title: Is It True That Everything Happens for a Reason?
description: People often say that everything happens for a reason.  However, this idea isn't Biblical and it gives people the wrong idea about God.  When people say that everything happens for a reason, they usually mean that whatever happens is exactly what God wanted to happen.  That isn't true.  There are 7 billion humans running around doing terrible things that God doesn't want them to do.  We shouldn't say that everything happens for a reason, but we can say that no matter what tragedy we experience, God has a way of redeeming it and making it part of our story of victory.

title: Jesus' Parable for the Modern Atheist
description:
Christians might be the only ones reading the Bible, but that doesn't mean that everything in the Bible is directed toward us.  The Parable of the Bags of Gold (or the Parable of the Talents) is a frightening parable, but the frightening part is not directed toward Christians, it is directed to those who are making excuses to avoid responsibility to their Creator.  If Jesus were here today, I think this might be a parable he would tell an atheist.
    Some Christians are misinterpreting this parable and wondering if the frightening part might apply to them.  In this video I will talk about why, if you are a believer in Jesus, the frightening part of the parable cannot apply to you.  And maybe...hopefully... the people that Jesus wants to direct this message to will hear it and heed his warning.

Scripture quotations taken from The Holy Bible, New International VersionÂ® NIVÂ®

Used by permission. All rights reserved worldwide.

title: How Did People Who Lived Before Jesus Get Saved?
description: Christians believe that Jesus died on the cross for the sins of the world and that anyone who believes in Jesus is forgiven of sins and has the promise of eternal life.  But what about the people who lived before Jesus died on the cross?  If Jesus is the only way to be forgiven and saved, what happened to all those people?  Those people were saved in the same way people are saved today:  by faith.  People who trusted in God to forgive their sins were saved by faith.  Think of salvation like a credit card.  The people who lived before Jesus ran up a huge debt, and Jesus paid the bill later.

title: O Holy Night
description:
O Holy Night produced and arranged by Sam Hashemi, sung by Rebekah Davis.

title: Things to Do Before Time Runs Out
description: Eternal life in the kingdom of God will be much better than our lives here.   But there are a few things that we won't be able to do in God's kingdom.  This video is  an encouragement and a reminder to do those things right now while you still have a chance.  If you are feeling discouraged about your life and wondering what your purpose in this life is, I hope this video will inspire you to make the most of your time in this world.

title: Cain and Abel:  The Offering God Favors
description:
Cain made an offering to God, but God favored his brother Abel's offering.  Cain killed Abel.  Some people ask, "Why didn't God accept Cain's offering?"  Cain's offering was insufficient, just as your offering to God is insufficient.  There is only one offering that God favors these days, and it is the offering of Jesus Christ on the cross.  This video discusses how Abel represents Jesus Christ and his righteous offering on our behalf.

title: What Is the Baptism of the Holy Spirit?
description:
John the Baptist said, "I baptize you with water, but he [Jesus] will baptize you in the Holy Spirit."  What does it mean that Jesus will baptize us in the Holy Spirit?  This topic causes a lot of confusion and controversy.  In this video I hope to give you an understanding of the baptism in the Holy Spirit by answering these questions:
#1 What is the baptism in the Holy Spirit?
#2 Is the baptism in the Holy Spirit a one-time experience? 
#3 Is this an event you need to wait for like the disciples waited in Jerusalem?  When does it happen? 
#4- What does it look like when someone is filled with the Spirit?  
#5- How do I know if I have the Holy Spirit?
#6 Is there a difference between having the Holy Spirit and being filled with the Holy Spirit?
#7 How do I know if Iâ€™ve been baptized the Holy Spirit?
 Much of the misunderstanding comes from our modern understanding of word "baptism" as a formal religious event.  To baptize just means to dunk.  There isn't just one type of baptism mentioned in the Bible.  There are many baptisms.  In addition to the Holy Spirit baptism, this video also explains the many types of baptisms mentioned in the Bible.  Thanks for watching!

Thanks for watching the Bread of Life Channel! Please subscribe: https://www.youtube.com/c/BreadofLifeChannel

title: Are Religions Like Ice Cream Flavors?
description: Some people say that religions are like ice cream flavors.  It doesn't matter which religion you choose, it is all a matter of personal preference.  But religions aren't all the same.  Religions aren't like ice cream flavors, they are more like different types of food.  The food you eat affects your health, and the religious ideas you embrace will affect your spiritual health.  Not all religious ideas are equal.  We cannot embrace all religious ideas as equal because some religious ideas are causing oppression and great harm to humanity.  This video is a short illustration of this point.  Thanks for watching!

title: Should Women Be Silent in Church?  A Discussion of 1 Corinthians 14:34-35
description:
The Bible teaches that men and women are equal- intellectually equal, morally equal, and with equal capacity for leadership.  But there are a few difficult and perplexing passages of the New Testament that seem to contradict the rest of the Bibleâ€™s treatment of women.  In this video, I will discuss one of those difficult passages:  1 Corinthians 14:34-35, and offer some possible explanations for these aberrant verses.  

Scripture quotations taken from The Holy Bible, New International VersionÂ® NIVÂ®
Copyright Â© 1973 1978 1984 2011 by Biblica, Inc. TM
Used by permission. All rights reserved worldwide.
1 Corinthians 14:34-35 is often cited by prominent Christian leaders as evidence that women should not be teachers in the church.  There is no textual support for the idea that women were silent participants in church gatherings.  It is clear from Paulâ€™s other writings, as well as other writings of the New Testament that women were serving as teachers, leaders, and even as apostles.  If you would like more information than provided in this video, check out these articles:

title: Jesus:  The Undercover Boss
description:
Philippians chapter 2 describes Jesus as God who came in human likeness.  Jesus was like a CEO who goes undercover and allows himself to be treated as an entry level employee.  Jesus temporarily left his high position and took the lowest place as a servant.  He did that for you and me.  This video explains Philippians chapter 2:3-11 using the modern day analogy of an undercover boss.  
Philippians 2:3-11 Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others. In your relationships with one another, have the same mindset as Christ Jesus:
Who, being in very nature God,
    did not consider equality with God something to be used to his own advantage; rather, he made himself nothing
    by taking the very nature of a servant,
    being made in human likeness.
And being found in appearance as a man,
    he humbled himself
    by becoming obedient to deathâ€”
        even death on a cross!
Therefore God exalted him to the highest place
    and gave him the name that is above every name,
that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow,
    in heaven and on earth and under the earth,
and every tongue acknowledge that Jesus Christ is Lord,
    to the glory of God the Father.

title: If You Don't Believe in God, Eventually You Have to Get Off His Couch
description: Sometimes people say, "I'm a good person, so won't God let me into heaven even if I didn't believe in him?"  Well, how long would you let someone live in your house and use all your stuff if that person didn't acknowledge your existence at all?  This video talks about why you need to acknowledge God and make the decision to be part of his family.  If you aren't part of the family, you don't get to stay. title: Why Doesn't God Speak to Me?

title: Is God in the Bible Vengeful or Loving?
description:
Many people have noticed what seems to be an inconsistency in the character of God in the Bible.  Sometimes God seems kind and loving, and at other times mean and vengeful.  People are right to point out the differences in God's actions.  But what people fail to realize is that God speaks differently depending on who he is talking to.  God is kind to the poor and oppressed, and vengeful toward the oppressors.  God's character is consistent throughout the Bible.  God's character is the same in the Old Testament and the New Testament. If you are oppressing the poor and vulnerable, carrying out violence, and denying people justice, you will see the vengeful side of God.  If you are among those who have experienced oppression and injustice, God is full of compassion for you and promises you hope for the future.  God will be vengeful when necessary, but he desires to be loving to all.

title: Hell Is NOT Unending Torment
description:
Is the idea of hell as unending torment really as Biblical as we've been conditioned to believe?  If you have ever doubted the justice of the concept of hell, this video will give you Biblical reasons to ditch the idea of unending torment, preserve the image of our loving God, and rescue the gospel message from the violence of the torturous flames.  
In order to make this video I read the entire New Testament and created a document that cites every reference to death, hell, judgment, varying degrees of judgment, and also every reference to eternal life, the concept of death verses life, and the kingdom of God.  For many of the passages I made a chart with the phrase in Greek so that the words used in the original language can be easily compared between various texts.  My research also included word studies on several words related to this debate, but for the sake of time and to keep the attention of the audience, I didnâ€™t bring the usage of these words into the video.  
To complete this study I read books and information from various perspectives.   Edward Fudge was the most scholarly, Biblical, fair, and persuasive writer and presenter on this topic.  His book is a major source of information in my video.  Here is the information for his book, as well as the links to a lecture by him, and a debate between him and a representative of the perspective of hell as unending torment.  

My other videos on hell:

title: How to Stop Judging People
description: The reason it is so easy to judge people is because people are frequently doing things that are worthy of judgment.  But you can stop judging if you take God's perspective.  God respects, honors, and enjoys people without regarding their bad actions.  God didn't excuse bad behavior, he put it to death on the cross.  God considered Christ's death on the cross the death of corrupt humanity.  2 Corinthians 5:16 says, "So from now on we regard no one from a worldly point of view."  You don't need to judge anyone by what you see from a worldly point of view.  Why?  Because "If anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation.  The old has passed away.  All things have been made new"  (verse 17).  We can give people perfect respect and honor because what remains of that old corrupted creation will be gone soon, and the new creation- perfect in beauty and glory- will be here for eternity.

title: Where Is the God of Miracles Today?
description:
The Bible is full of miracles.  Some people wonder why they aren't seeing God do miracles today.  Just because you haven't seen a miracle doesn't mean God isn't doing miracles today.  God is doing miracles today.  This video discusses some possible reasons you may not have seen a miracle, and what our attitude toward miracles should be.

Not included in the video, but relevant to the subject, is a calculation I did regarding miracles.  I'm not good at math, so if any mathematician or statistician has a better way to calculate this, please feel free.  In the video I mention that I believe God will do more miracles in the next 24 hours than all the miracles mentioned in the Bible.  Starting with an approximate number of miracles mentioned in the Bible at 160, I calculated how many miracles that would be during the span of an average lifetime of 80 years.  160 miracles per day for 80 years = 4,672,000 miracles during a human lifetime of 80 years.  Dividing the approximate number of people on earth (7.5 billion) by this number gives us one miracle for every 1,605 people.  So if God is doing 160 miracles per day, only one person out of 1,605 is going to experience a miracle in their lifetime.  This may help a skeptic understand why they have personally not seen a miracle even though God is doing many miracles all the time.

title: Does the Bible Teach that Women Cannot Have Authority Over Men?
description:
Does 1 Timothy 2:11-15 teach that women should not teach men or have positions of authority over men?  No, it does not.  Here is an explanation of this difficult passage that puts it in its cultural context.  Understanding the cultural context helps make sense of these seemingly nonsensical verses.  These were pushy women pushing Artemis, and Paul put a stop to it.  This passage should not be used to prevent women from teaching or leading men in the church.  

Mike Winger and some other popular Christian teachers push the idea that women cannot have leadership roles in the church.  Despite their assurances about the "clear teaching of scripture," these passages about women are not clearly teaching the ideas they promote about women having different roles.

A considerable amount of research went into making this video.  And there were many more points that I would have liked to include but couldnâ€™t do so because it would have made the video too lengthy.  If you would like to study this topic more deeply, my sources for this video are included here, as well as some additional notes that might be helpful:
       Paul affirms women in leadership:
Rom. 16:1â€“2 Pheobe church leader
Romans 16:3-5 Priscilla leader and teacher of men (Acts 18:24â€“26), 
Romans 16:7 Junia an apostle
Philippians 4:2-3 Euodia, Syntyche, shared in Paulâ€™s work
Col. 4:15- Nympha church leader
Philemon 2 Appia a house church leader

My interpretive translation of 1Timothy 2:11-15:
â€œA woman should take time to quietly learn about the Christian faith in submission to sound doctrine.  I donâ€™t permit a woman to dominate men, teaching these false ideas about feminine virtue that are part of the cult of Artemis, because female life is not independent from man.  Actually, a man, Adam, was formed first; then the female, Eve. You shouldnâ€™t regard women as superior, because the first woman got deceived and became a sinner just like Adam did.  And tell the women not to worry about letting go of Artemisâ€™s help for childbirth.  If they continue in faith, God will save them during childbirth.â€
